Film market in full swing
     Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- A film market which opened at Yanggakdo International Hotel on Sept. 5 is expected to last till Sept. 13 as part of the 8th Pyongyang Film Festival of Non-Aligned and Other Developing Countries.
 The market is abustle with many foreign delegations, delegates and moviemen participating in the festival and film lovers.    
 Pre-views of not only films contributed to the festival but those not presented are held and contracts for exchanging movies concluded among countries at the market.

articles.content:
DPRK delegation back
    Pyongyang, September 10 (KCNA) -- The DPRK delegation headed by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday returned home after visiting Namibia, Angola and South Africa and participating in the world summit on sustained development held in South Africa.
 It was greeted at the airport by Kim Yun Hyok, secretary of the spa presidium, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of foreign affairs, and other officials concerned and Chinese charge d'affaires here Tian Baozhen.
